Another hacker or group of hackers using the moniker Guccifer 2.0 has claimed credit for breaking into the files of the Democratic National Committee and posting the information online shortly before the Democratic Convention in July.

He claimed publicly that he hacked into Hillary Clinton’s infamous private email server — “it was like an open orchid on the internet,” he told NBC News earlier this year — but there’s no evidence he actually did so.
A Romanian computer whiz known as Guccifer was sentenced to over four years in federal lockup on Thursday for hacking into computer accounts of the Bush family and other former government officials.
Marcel Lehel Lazar, 44, of Arad, Romania, was sentenced in Virginia federal court to 52 months in prison for unauthorized access to a protected computer and aggravated identity theft.
He pleaded guilty earlier this year to gaining unauthorized access to personal email and social media accounts of over 100 Americans between October of 2012 and January of 2014.
